edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.postagger.smoothing.contextual
Class AbstractContextualSmoother

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.at.utils.IsCloseableObject
      edu.northwestern.at.utils.corpuslinguistics.postagger.smoothing.contextual.AbstractContextualSmoother
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContextualSmoother, UsesLogger
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdditiveContextualSmoother, DeletedInterpolationContextualSmoother
public abstract class AbstractContextualSmoother
extends IsCloseableObject
implements ContextualSmoother, UsesLogger

Abstract contextual smoother.

An abstract contextual smoother which provides implementations of common service methods such as setting the lexicon and the transition probability matrix. Extend this class and override the abstract method "contextualProbability" to produce a new contextual smoother.

contextualProbability

public abstract Probability contextualProbability(java.lang.String word,
                                                  java.lang.String tag)
Get contextually smoothed probability of a word given a tag.

Specified by:
contextualProbability in interface ContextualSmoother
Parameters:
word - The word.
tag - The part of speech tag.
Returns:
Contextually smoothed probability of word given tag, e.g., p( word | tag ).

To avoid redoing potentially expensive probability calculations, you can use the "cachedContextualProbabilities" HashMap2D to store probabilities once they are calculated. Your contextualProbability method should look to see if the cache contains the needed contextual probability. If so, just retrieve it without recomputing it. If the cache does not contain the probability, compute it, and store it in the cache for future use.

Here is what a contextualProbability method should look like, using the cache. 

        protected Probability contextualProbability( String word , String tag )
        {
                                                                //      See if the contextual probability
                                                                //      p( word | tag ) is in the cache.

                Probability result      =
                        (Probability)cachedContextualProbabilities.get( word , tag );

                                                                //      If the probability isn't in the
                                                                //      cache, compute it.

                if ( result == null )
                {
                        double prob             = compute smoothed probability value

                                                                //      Store computed probability in
                                                                //      the cache.

                        result  = new Probability( prob );

                        cachedContextualProbabilities.put( word , tag , result );
                }

                return result;
        }
